SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain
Interface Invoice

public interface Invoice

The Invoice is a container for items that a merchant usually transacts against.
It is a helpful abstraction that keeps track of tips(gratuity), various totals (item subtotal, grandtotal, tax total etc).
The invoice object is filled with utility APIs to get various properties such as the quantity for
a given item, total of quantities etc. Together, these APIs represent an easy to use interface that
an app can use to manage transactions
One of the most useful components of this invoice object is the way it keeps track of items and helps
with calculating totals, tax rates etc.
The SDK internally ensures that the totals calculated here
are in sync with the totals calculated by the PayPal backend

Method Detail

getGrandTotal

java.math.BigDecimal getGrandTotal()
Returns the current grand total taking into account all the cart items, any tip that has been added, any discount that's been applied, and the tax total (if taxes are enabled).

Returns:
A BigDecimal representing the value of the Invoice. Units are based on the InvoiceItem units.

getSubTotal

java.math.BigDecimal getSubTotal()
Returns the total value of all the InvoiceItem(s). Takes into account the quantity of each item. This call does not consider any tax nor does it consider any tip that might be present.

Returns:
A BigDecimal representing the value of the Invoice items. Units are based on the InvoiceItem units.

getDiscount

Discount getDiscount()
Returns any Discount that has been applied. Note that the discount is applied to the invoice as a whole and not on a per item basis

Returns:
A Discount object describing the magnitude & type of the discount.

setDiscount

void setDiscount(Discount discount)
Allows you to set a discount to be used with this Invoice.

Parameters:
discount - A Discount object describing the magnitude & type of the discount.

getDiscountTotal

java.math.BigDecimal getDiscountTotal()
Returns the total amount applied by the discount.

Returns:
A value indicating how much money we discounted for this purchase.

getTipAmount

java.math.BigDecimal getTipAmount()
Returns the value of the tip that was applied to this Invoice.

Returns:
A BigDecimal describing the magnitude of the tip that was previously set on this cart.

setTip

void setTip(Tip tip)
Allows you to set a tip amount to use with this Invoice.

Parameters:
tip - A Tip object which can be a percentage tip or an amount tip

getTip

Tip getTip()
Fetch the tip used in this invoice.

Returns:
A Tip object which represents either a percentage or fixed amount tip.

getTaxEnabled

boolean getTaxEnabled()
Determine if the tax amount should be added to the grand total.

Returns:
true if tax will be added to the grand total.

void setTaxEnabled(boolean enabled)

A BigDecimal describing the total item tax.

getItems

java.util.List<InvoiceItem> getItems()
Returns a copy of this Invoice's list of CartItems.

Returns:

getId

java.lang.String getId()
Retrieve the unique ID of this invoice. This ID is generated by the PayPal services and NOT generated locally by the client. When an invoice is first created it may not be synced up with the services in the backend in which case the id returned will be null. You can invoked the save API to force the Invoice object to sync up with the backend.

Returns:
a string that represents the unique invoice id.

getItemQuantities

java.util.HashMap<InvoiceItem,java.lang.Long> getItemQuantities()
Returns a map of the Invoice Items to the quantity of each item in the cart.

getTotalOfAllQuantities

long getTotalOfAllQuantities()
Returns the total number of items in a cart. This call takes into account the quantity of each item.

Returns:

setQuantityForItem

void setQuantityForItem(InvoiceItem item,
                        long newQuantity)
Adjust the quantity of an item in the cart. If quantity is less than 1 we'll remove the item from the cart.

Parameters:
item -
newQuantity -

addItem

void addItem(InvoiceItem item,
             long quantityToAdd)
Add a Invoice item to the list with the given quantity. If you add an item that is already in the Invoice we'll change the quantity of that item by the amount specified in newQuantity. For example, if you have 4 apples already in the Invoice, and you call addItem(appleItem, 6) there will now be 10 apples in the Invoice. Negative values are allowed. If you pass a negative value the quantity of that item will be decremented. If the quantity ever hits zero that item will be removed from the Invoice.

Parameters:
item - The item you would like to add to the Invoice.
quantityToAdd - The quantity amount you would like to add for this item.

addItem

void addItem(InvoiceItem item,
             long newQuantity,
             boolean autoRecalculate)
Adds an item to our Invoice with the given quantitiy.

Parameters:
item - The InvoiceItem to add
newQuantity - The additional quantity to add to the cart.
autoRecalculate - Boolean specifying if we should automatically recalculate the subtotal, taxtotal, and grand total.
If you pass false we will not update the total calculations in the cart until you explicitly call .recalculate()

removeItem

void removeItem(InvoiceItem item)
Remove this item completely from the Invoice.

Parameters:
item - Which InvoiceItem to remove.

recalculate

void recalculate()
Cause the Invoice to recalculate its subtotal, tax total, and grand total. Normally this is done internally when an item is added or removed. However, if you change the price of an item that was previously added you'll need to call recalculate or the Invoice totals will not be updated.

getCopy

Invoice getCopy()
Returns a copy of this Invoice.

Returns:

getShipping

Shipping getShipping()
Get a container object that represents the Shipping information associated with this Invoice.

Returns:
a Shipping object. Null if Shipping info is not applicable

setShipping

void setShipping(Shipping shippingInfo)
Allows you to set the shipping information for this Invoice.

Parameters:
shippingInfo -

getBuyerInfo

BuyerInfo getBuyerInfo()
getBuyerInfo retrieves an object that represents the Buyer's info. The BuyerInfo object is documented
separately and has details on the various APIs available there.

Returns:

setBuyerInfo

void setBuyerInfo(BuyerInfo buyerInfo)
setBuyerInfo set an object that contains all the relevant BuyerInfo. NOTE: be careful with the usage of this setter alongside the other setters. For ex: setBuyerInfo will set the BuyerInfo which in turn
contains the ShippingInfo as well. If you use the setShipping call and then use the setBuyerInfo call
then the ShippingInfo will be overwritten by the values inside BuyerInfo. If you intend to use the BuyerInfo
setter ensure that the Shipping info is set in that BuyerInfo object as well

Parameters:
buyerInfo -

getBuyerEmail

java.lang.String getBuyerEmail()
getPayerEmail retrieves the

Returns:

setBuyerEmail

void setBuyerEmail(java.lang.String buyerEmail)
setBuyerEmail - set the email address for the Buyer. This is a utility API meant to make it easy for the app to an email id for the buyer. NOTE that this information is internally stored as part of
BuyerInfo. If the app intends to set the BuyerInfo value directly then it should ensure that the
email is correctly set in BuyerInfo.

Parameters:
buyerEmail - - a string that represents the buyer's email address

getSeller

Merchant getSeller()
Get a handle to the Merchant object associated with this Invoice

Returns:
Merchant

setReferrerCode

void setReferrerCode(java.lang.String referrerCode)
Used for partner attributions so we know how the invoices were created. The partner app doesn't need to make use of this API if the referrer code has already been set within the PayPalHereSDK.java class : PayPalHereSDK.init or PayPalHereSDK.setReferrerCode APIs. If the referrer code hasn't been set within the PayPalHereSDK class or if we need to change referrer code for any reason, we set the new referrer code using this api without having to re-init the SDK.

Parameters:
referrerCode - : a referrer code string that is used to identify a partner.

getReferrerCode

java.lang.String getReferrerCode()
used to fetch the referrer code set for this partner.

Returns:
String: a string referrer code.

setCashierId

void setCashierId(java.lang.String cashierId)
method to set the merchant's individual cashier id which distinguishes the different cashiers available for the same merchant. For example, whole foods could be a merchant that has various cashiers spread across to collect payments from customer. Each of those cashiers could be assigned a unique id.

Parameters:
cashierId - : a unique string that identifies this cashier for a given merchant.

getCashierId

java.lang.String getCashierId()
method to fetch the cashier id for this merchant.

Returns:
: a string id that represents the cashier id for this merchant.

setCustomAmount

void setCustomAmount(java.math.BigDecimal customAmount,
                     java.lang.String customAmountName)
Add a custom amount to the Invoice for miscellaneous charges. The CustomAmount value is applied to the entire Invoice. The application should also provide a custom amount name as description

Parameters:
customAmount -
customAmountName -

getMemo

java.lang.String getMemo()
Retrieve the memo field data that was set in the invoice

getCardLastFour

java.lang.String getCardLastFour()
If an Invoice was paid with a CreditCard then this API can be used to determine the last four digits of the credit card number

Returns:
last four digits of the card number. If the invoice is either unpaid or not paid with a credit card this will return the string "NotAvailable"

getPaymentMethod

PaymentMethod getPaymentMethod()
Retrieve the PaymentMethod associated with this Invoice. The default payment method is set to CARD
but this value is automatically configured when making a transaction using this Invoice. For ex: when
the TransactionManager's takePayment() API is invoked with PaymentType set to CASH this will automatically
be update in the Invoice as well

Returns:
the payment method used to collect funds against this Invoice.

setDueDate

void setDueDate(java.util.Date dueDate)
Set the due date for this Invoice. For most use cases, this is date is the same as when the Invoice
is created and is set as the default value. However, for some cases the due date could be set to a
value determined by the app

Parameters:
dueDate -

getDueDate

java.util.Date getDueDate()
get the due date set on this Invoice.

Returns:

getInvoiceDate

java.util.Date getInvoiceDate()
getInvoiceDate is used to determine the date when the Invoice was created. Regardless of the due date, the
invoiceDate is always determined by when the invoice was created

Returns:
the date when the invoice was created.

getAsJSON

java.lang.String getAsJSON()
fetch the current Invoice object as a JSONified string representation that can be sent directly to
the servers as a payload.

Returns:
the invoice data represented in jsonified String

save

void save(DefaultResponseHandler<java.lang.Boolean,PPError<PPError.BasicErrors>> handler)
Save the invoice with the backend. This is an asynchronous call and will return right away but will
invoke the callback handler once the network response comes through. If no callback handler is provided
then the network operation will not be performed.

Parameters:
handler -

send

void send(DefaultResponseHandler<java.lang.Boolean,PPError<PPError.BasicErrors>> handler)
This will send the invoice to the Buyer based on the BuyerInfo available with the Invoice. This is
an asynchronous call that will return right away but the callback will be invoked later when the
network response is available. If no callback handler is provided then this API will not perform the
network request

Parameters:
handler -

cancel

void cancel(DefaultResponseHandler<java.lang.Boolean,PPError<PPError.BasicErrors>> handler)
Use this API to cancel an Invoice. This will notify the backend that the invoice needs to be canceled.
NOTE: not all Invoices are cancelable. For ex: an Invoice that is already paid cannot be canceled. If such
errors occur, the SDK will notify the app via the callback handler.

Parameters:
handler -

getTaxInclusive

boolean getTaxInclusive()
Are we using inclusive taxes or exclusive taxes? Returns true if we're using inclusive taxes, false otherwise.

setTaxInclusive

void setTaxInclusive(boolean useInclusiveTax)
Allows the app to specify if we should use an inclusive tax model

Parameters:
useInclusiveTax -

getTaxCalculatedAfterDiscount

boolean getTaxCalculatedAfterDiscount()
Are we calculating taxes after the discount?

Returns:
a boolean. True if we're calculating taxes after applying discounts

setTaxCalculatedAfterDiscount

void setTaxCalculatedAfterDiscount(boolean taxCalculatedAfterDiscount)
Configure the invoice to (or not to) calculate taxes after applying discounts

Parameters:
taxCalculatedAfterDiscount - a boolean. Send 'true' if you wish taxes to be calculated after applying discounts.

getItemById

InvoiceItem getItemById(java.lang.String itemName)
Method to fetch the invoice item given the item name;

Parameters:
itemName - : item name of the invoice item that has to be retrieved.
Returns:
: An InvoiceItem obj with the given name if found, else null.
